items.title: The EU needs to figure out how to ramp up their military capabilities fast | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>Europe is planning a massive hike in defense spending to counter the threat from Russia and Germany is leading the way.  On Friday, the German Bundesrat or Federal Council gave the green light to an almost unlimited increase in defense spending.  All of this comes a day after the European Union agreed to hike defense spending by €800 billion.  Huge sums of money.   
2:22 Marina Miron, Military analyst, King’s College London

#germany #europe #military 
For more news go to: http://www.dw.com/en/

items.title: More and more people trying to visit the United States end up behind bars | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>A number of countries have updated their travel advice to the United States in the wake of a crackdown on immigration by the Trump administration. Travelers have reported being detained at the US border, even though they had valid travel visas. Germany updated its travel advisory for the US this week after a number of its citizens were detained at customs and then deported.

0:00 What's behind the Trump administrations strikt entry requirements 
3:04 David Bier, Director of immigration studies at the Cato Institute in Washington, DC
#trump #usa #travel

items.title: Ukraine not only gets military aid from its supporters, but produces its own weapons, too | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>Ongoing US military support for Ukraine looks anything but certain — even as Russia continues to attack its critical infrastructure with drones and cruise missiles. The Ukrainian military has been able to turn to Germany for additional air defense systems — one of them called the "IRIS-T". 
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has announced that his country has successfully deployed a long-range guided cruise missile. That would expand its ability to strike deep into Russia. 
The so-called Long Neptune is a version of the anti-ship Neptune. Zelenskyy claims the Long Neptune can reach targets up to 1,000 kilometers away.

0:00 DW correspondent Max Zander was given the opportunity to meet with an Iris - T crew in western Ukraine
2:43 Ukraine deploys self-produced cruise missile
3:28 Mykola Bielieskov, Research fellow at the Ukrainian National Institute for Strategic Studies

#russiaukrainewar #ukraine #weapons 

For more news go to: http://www.dw.com/en/

items.title: Germany boosts massive European defense spending for Ukraine: How will the money be spent? | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>German lawmakers have agreed to provide an additional 11 billion euros in support for Ukraine in the coming years. The agreement includes an additional 3 billion this year alone. Germany's Conservatives, Social Democrats, and Greens agreed on a deal to loosen debt restrictions on military spending. Outgoing Chancellor Olaf Scholz had made the relaxation of the so-called debt brake a prerequisite for the additional Ukraine aid. 


Chapter Breakdown:
0:00 Breakdown of German aid for Ukraine
2:22 DW Correspondent Political Correspondent Simon Young on Germany's approval of additional defense and Ukraine military spending
5:57 Benjamin Tallis, Democratic Strategy Initiative Director,
 on how the Ukraine aid is expected to be spent
#ukraine #germanmilitaryspending
#merz

items.title: Heathrow airport to resume 'some flights' Friday, expects full service on Saturday | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>Heathrow airport says it expects to be able to restart flights within the coming hours. Airport officials say "some flights" will resume tonight, with full operation beginning Saturday morning. Passengers are being told not to travel to the airport until their airlines give them the green light to do so. Europe's busiest airport was closed on Thursday night by a power outage caused by a fire at an electrical substation. The blaze is being investigated by counter-terror police, but they have said there are no indications of foul play.  The head of British Airways says it will be a major logisitical challenge for airlines to resume their flight schedules, as aircraft and crews may not be in place to fly when Heathrow reopens.  

Chapter Breakdown:
0:00 Heathrow airport to resume some flights Friday
1:15 Robin Preece, power systems engineer, Associate Professor, University of Manchester, on aftermath of Heathrow airport's shuttering

#heathrowairportlondon #heathrow #airportfire

items.title: The Truth Behind Global Inequality | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>From Ghana to China to the United States, there's a hidden force that shapes the fate of countries: institutions. When they’re inclusive, nations thrive. When they’re captured, everything falls apart. 
In this documentary, Nobel Prize winner James A. Robinson explores why democracy isn't enough, if institutions are built to fail. 

#nobelprizewinner #trump 
#inequality

items.title: Doctor in Gaza: 'Only three ventilators' in all of north due to Israeli blockade | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>Israel's military says it has begun a new ground operation in Rafah, in the Gaza Strip's south. It comes after another day of airstrikes and ground operations in northern Gaza. Earlier on Thursday, Hamas fired rockets at central Israel. Israel said it had intercepted one of the missiles and that the others caused no injuries.
In Gaza, Palestinians face life-threatening food, fuel, and medical supply shortages, all exacerbated by the Israeli military's resumption of strikes. 

Chapter Breakdown:
0:00 DW's Tania Krämer and Mohammad al Madhoon report on Israel's resumption of its ground operation and airstrikes in Gaza
3:05 Mohammed Mustafa, Australian doctor in Gaza, on catastrophic lack of medical supplies

#israeliblockade
#gaza #israelhamaswar

items.title: Why saving the planet's glaciers is a matter of survival | DW Mews
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>Today marks the first World Day for Glaciers. Years of rapid glacier retreat mean many are unlikely to survive the 21st century. With glaciers shrinking, this event is less of a celebration, and more of a reckoning. Glaciers and mountain ice caps store about 70% of global freshwater resources. In recent years, glacier ice has receded at a record rate. The loss ranges from 2% in the Antarctic to almost 40% in Central Europe. 

DW caught up with well-traveled photographer Sean Gallup, whose pictures over the past nine years show the stark transformation in the landscape. 

Chapter Breakdown:
0:00 Sean Gallup's photographs over the past nine years illustrate a stark transformation in the landscape. 
3:14 John Kennedy, Scientific Coordinator for the World Meteorological Organization, on climate change's acceleration and global loss of glacier ice


#glacier #iceshrinking
#glaciermass

For more news go to: http://www.dw.com/en/

items.title: Israel's high court freezes Netanyahu's dismissal of Shin Bet chief | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>Israel's Supreme Court has put a temporary halt on the dismissal of Shin Bet chief Ronen Bar. Earlier, the Israeli government had approved Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's proposal to remove the domestic intelligence head from his post. The court's recent temporary freeze enables petitions against Bar's dismissal. Netanyahu said he had lost confidence in Bar long ago, while Bar himself had previously hinted he might resign after taking responsibility for intelligence failures over the October 7 Hamas terror attacks.

#shinbet #ronen #netanyahu

items.title: Sudan's army says it has recaptured the presidential palace in the capital Khartoum | DW News
items.author: DW News
items.content:
<article>The Sudanese army says it has recaptured the presidential palace in the capital Khartoum. After days of heavy fighting, the army swept through the city in an attempt to push back the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces. Videos posted on social media appear to show soldiers celebrating inside the palace. An army leader has described the apparent takeover as a 'crowning achievement.' The RSF has now responded, claiming that the battle for the palace is 'not over yet.'

For more news go to: http://www.dw.com/en/
